home.header.sub.title: Unleashing the power of agricultural statistics
home.header.title: Senegal Agridata Platform
home.intro.text: Senegal AgriData Platform - a joint initiative between Initiative Prospective Agricole et Rurale (IPAR) and the National Statistical Agency (ANSD) to foster agricultural development in Senegal
home.intro.title: Senegal Agridata Platform
home.newsletter.title: Subscribe to our newsletter
home.presented.text: The AgriData platform aims to bring science to the Senegalese agricultural sector by providing key support decision information to policymakers while empowering farmers and other relevant value chain actors.
home.tabs.indicator.source: Data comes from DAPSA, ANSD and FAO
home.tabs.indicator.text: The Indicators page displays the alignment of specific agricultural indicators against the SDGs and the ones managed by the International System for Agricultural Science and Technology (AGRIS). All tables and charts will be automatically updated as new information is entered in the system. Users can use the date and the region filters to refine their search criteria.
home.tabs.indicator.title: Indicators
home.tabs.market.source: Data comes from DAPSA, ANSD and FAO
home.tabs.market.text: The market page displays crop trend market prices collected only in rural collection markets located in agricultural production areas.
home.tabs.market.title: Market
home.tabs.microdata.source: Data comes from DAPSA, ANSD and FAO
home.tabs.microdata.text: The Microdata page displays agricultural databases that have been uploaded by each relevant partner organization. Users can use the platform analysis tools to browse and extract needed information from the available datasets that will be regurlaly updated as new information is entered.
home.tabs.microdata.title: Microdata
home.weather.subtitle_1: This is where the short descriptive line will go here to describe the category

indicators.chart.aoi.description: The agriculture orientation index for government expenditures
indicators.chart.aoi.title: The Agriculture Orientation Index for Government Expenditures
indicators.chart.aoi.total.public.budget: Total public budget, expenditure on the agricultural sector.
indicators.chart.aoi.total.public.subsid: Composition of subsidies to agricultural investments.
indicators.chart.food.description: The average distribution of production presents the different types of use of production by households.
indicators.chart.food.title: Average distribution of production
indicators.chart.poverty.by.poor.no.poor: % of poor vs no poor by region ({year}).
indicators.chart.poverty.description: Proportion of population below the international poverty line, by sex, age, employment status and geographical location (urban/rural).
indicators.chart.poverty.title: Proportion of population below the international poverty line.
indicators.chart.women.description: Proportion of total agricultural population with ownership or secure rights over agricultural land, by sex; and (b) share of women among owners or rights-bearers of agricultural land, by type of tenure.
indicators.chart.women.distribution.by.e: Historical female distribution of parcels by method of enforcement.
indicators.chart.women.distribution.by.g: Distribution of the agricultural population by age group and gender ({year}).
indicators.chart.women.title: Women in the Agricultural sector
indicators.filter.title: Indicator Filter
indicators.global.aoi.short: Agriculture orientation index for government expenditures
indicators.global.intro: This page displays the alignment of specific agricultural indicators against the SDGs and the ones managed by the International System for Agricultural Science and Technology (AGRIS). All tables and charts will be automatically updated as new information is entered in the system. Users can use the date and the region filters to refine their search criteria.
